title: How to Automate Nutrition Data Extraction from Websites in Firefox?
content:
I frequently track nutritional information from websites like Popeyes Menu USA to log my meals, but manually copying data is inefficient.

I’m looking for a way to automate the extraction of structured data (e.g., calories, macros) from restaurant websites using Firefox. I’ve considered:

Firefox extensions (like Web Scraper or Tampermonkey)

JavaScript-based automation (via Greasemonkey or Selenium)

Firefox’s built-in dev tools for scraping and exporting structured data

Has anyone successfully implemented an automated data extraction workflow in Firefox? Would using an API-based solution be more efficient than web scraping in this case? Any guidance or experience would be appreciated!
creator: BAKHAT_ALI
